projects.title: Turing Machine Simulator
projects.description:
Written in ruby, this program allows the user to create and run Turing machine programs from the terminal. This little program can solve any problem! 

This was developed as an experiment for what could be done in a terminal. 

[Github](http://www.github.com/dshiller/turingmachine)

projects.title: Neural Network Project
projects.description:
A JavaScript tool for building neural networks. The networks can be hooked up to control the movements of a simple artificial creature. Inspired by the ediacaran trace fossils.

Networks are drawn on an html canvas that accommodates zooming and scrolling.

[Live](http://www.derekshiller.com/nnp/nnp.html)  [Github](http://github.com/dcshiller/nnp)

projects.title: Where Do They Publish?
projects.description:
A tool written as an experiment with Go. This program queries for articles by author and compiles them, listing where the given authors publish. The data is very incomplete.

[live](http://wheredotheypublish.derekshiller.com)

projects.title: A Primitive Solution to the Negation Problem
projects.description: A response to Unwin and Schroeder's Negation Problem. I make the case that metaethical expressivists should be unbothered by a large number of brute norms, and hence that they should be free to postulate their way out of the negation problem.

projects.title: The Unity of Moral Attitudes
projects.description: This paper offers my solution to the problem explored in my  'The Problem of Other Attitudes'. According to this solution, moral attitudes are distinguished by their functional properties in a restricted range of contexts, and by the the resemblance of their ingredients in other contexts.

projects.title: In Defense of Artificial Replacement
projects.description: If it is within our power to provide a significantly better world for future generations at a comparatively small cost to ourselves, we have a strong moral reason to do so. One way of providing a significantly better world may involve replacing our species with something better. It is plausible that in the not-too-distant future, we will be able to create artificially intelligent creatures with whatever physical and psychological traits we choose. Granted this assumption, it is argued that we should engineer our extinction so that our planet's resources can be devoted to making artificial creatures with better lives.

projects.title: Hidden Qualia
projects.description: In this paper, I propose that those who reject higher-order theories of consciousness should not rule out the possibility of having conscious experiences that they cannot introspect.

projects.title: The Problem of Other Attitudes
projects.description: This paper presents a related problem concerning how noncognitivists might extend their accounts of moral judgments to other kinds of moral attitudes, such as moral hopes and moral intuitions. After presenting the problem, several contemporary theories with some initial promise for solving it are examined and found to be insufficient.

projects.title: JSON tractatus
projects.description: A copy of Wittgenstein's Logico-Philosophicus, translated into English, in JSON format.
